TableDefinition.DatabaseQuery: SELECT DISTINCT workflowinstances.[ID], [assignedTo], [dateAssigned], workflows.name, [instanceTitle], [dateCreated] FROM [workflowInstances] INNER JOIN [workflows] ON workflows.ID = workflowinstances.workflowID INNER JOIN [workflowInstanceHistory] ON workflowInstanceHistory.workflowInstanceID = workflowinstances.ID where [closed] = 0 and [hideFromDashboard] = 0

Value.TextValue: Provider=SQLOLEDB.1;Password=oquK0PH4;Persist Security Info=True;User ID=svc_umra_db;Data Source=ba13-0151\vsql02;Use Procedure for Prepare=1;Auto Translate=True;Packet Size=4096;Workstation ID=BA13-0070;Use Encryption for Data=False;Tag with column collation when possible=False

TableDefinition.DatabaseQuery: SELECT DISTINCT workflowinstances.[ID], [delegatedTo], [dateAssigned], workflows.name, [instanceTitle], [dateCreated] FROM [workflowInstances] INNER JOIN [workflows] ON workflows.ID = workflowinstances.workflowID INNER JOIN [workflowInstanceHistory] ON workflowInstanceHistory.workflowInstanceID = workflowinstances.ID INNER JOIN [workflowDelegation] ON workflowDelegation.delegatedBy = workflowInstances.assignedTo where [closed] = 0 and [hideFromDashboard] = 0 and [sendEmail] = 1 and [delegationEndDate] > getdate()

Data.TextValue:
Dear %AD_displayName%,

A request has been made on %WFM_instance_dateAssigned_date_day%-%WFM_instance_dateAssigned_date_month%-%WFM_instance_dateAssigned_date_year%, which has been assigned to you for approval:

Request type: %WFM_instance_workflow_name%

Follow the link below to process the request:
Process request

Best regards,
Tools4ever Self Service Portal

Base.Explanation: Send an HTML e-mail message with attachments (optional) to the specified E-mail address. All parameters can contain variables.

ArrayElement.Name: SMTP server
ArrayElement.Description: The DNS name or IP address of the SMTP server to be used by UMRA to send the e-mail (example: mail.company.com). Optionally, the SMTP port can be specified (mail.company.com:25). By default, port number 25 is used.

ArrayElement.Name: To
ArrayElement.Description: The recipient of the e-mail message. To specify multiple recipients, use a semi-colon (;) to separate the recipients (example: john@domain.com; william@company.com).

ArrayElement.Name: Cc
ArrayElement.Description: The recipients that should receive a copy of the e-mail message. To specify multiple recipients, use a semi-colon (;) to separate the copied recipients (example: john@domain.com; william@company.com).

ArrayElement.Name: Bcc
ArrayElement.Description: The recipients that should receive a blind copy of the e-mail message. To specify multiple recipients, use a semi-colon (;) to separate the copied recipients (example: john@domain.com; william@company.com).

ArrayElement.Name: From
ArrayElement.Description: The name of the sender of the e-mail message (example: john@company.com).

ArrayElement.Name: Subject
ArrayElement.Description: The subject of the e-mail message (example: User creation report).

ArrayElement.Name: HTML file
ArrayElement.Description: The name of the file that contains the HTML contents of the e-mail message. Specify either this property or property 'HTML text'. The HTML contents of the file can contain UMRA variables. If the HTML contents contains links to files, the files should be contained in the same directory as the file or in the directory specified by property 'HTML link directory'. (example: D:\UMRA\EmailTemplates\UserCreationReport.html).

ArrayElement.Name: HTML text
ArrayElement.Description: The HTML contents of the e-mail message. Specify either this property or property 'HTML file'. The HTML contents can contain UMRA variables. If the HTML contents contains links to files, these files should be contained in the directory specified with property 'HTML link directory' (example: <HTML> ... </HTML>).

ArrayElement.Name: HTML link directory
ArrayElement.Description: The directory that contains the files referred to in the HTML contents, specified with property 'HTML text' or 'HTML file' (example: D:\UMRA\EmailTemplates\images).

ArrayElement.Name: Attachments
ArrayElement.Description: The name of one or more files to be attached to the e-mail message. To specify multiple attachments, use the semi-colon (;) as a separator character (example: D:\UMRA\Data\UserLog.txt).
